comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: In 1919, Jeanne Marie "Mimi" Scott, only daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George I Scott of Rhode Island, married Philander Lathrop Cable, who worked at the American Embassy in Paris. She's referred to as "vacuous" in a biography of her former fiance, aviator Hobey Baker (1892-1918): books.google.com/books?id=mocbzPmUjSMC&pg=PA111&l...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your research into Mimi Scott, pennylrichardsca. Looks like she didn't waste any time in choosing another husband. See: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F10814FA345D14.... The article also points out that she was a nurse in France during the war, so not completely "vacuous". We'll fill in her name and correct the typo in the other woman's name the next time we update.
